issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: BufferedOutputStream in FileUtil#unpackEntries() should be closed in finally block

comments.body: I add try-catch-finally block and write outputStream.close() in finally.

Thanks for your reporting, [~yunsh]. As [~cmccabe] told me on HDFS-6902, it's better to use IOUtils.cleanup(LOG, outputStream) in final block. Do you mind updating a patch?
[~ozawa], Thanks for your review! I modified code using IOUtils.cleanup() method.

This message is automatically generated.
Please review my patch, [~ozawa] and [~tedyu]. :)

[~yunsh], thanks for updating a patch. I rethought of the usage of IOUtils - in fact, unpackEntries is only called from FileUtil#unTarUsingJava. FileUtil#unTarUsingJava closes all inputStream in finally block if there are any exceptions in unpackEntries. So, I think we don't need to cleanup the descriptors in unpackEntries. What do you think?

Thanks for your review, [~ozawa].
I think tis or inputStream in FileUtil#unTarUsingJava is differrent from outputStream in FileUtil#unpackEntries.
outputStream is created newly in FileUtil#unpackEntries. So, need to cleanup.

This message is automatically generated.

[~yunsh] Sorry for the delay. Rethinking of using IOUtils - in this case, I found that we should raise IOException to {{unTarUsingJava}} and stop the execution immediately when {{FileOutputStream#close}} raises IOException. So, could you update the patch based on v1 including comments by Akira?

Thanks for comments, [~ajisakaa] and [~ozawa].
I agree that FileUtil#unpackEntries() raise the exception.
So, I attached a new patch file.

+1, LGTM.

[~yunsh] Sorry for iterative comments - how about using try-with-resources since we only support JDK7+ now. Do you mind updating it?
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/language/try-with-resources.html

Taking this issue as part of Bug Bash. [~yunsh] if you are still interested in working on this feel free to assign to yourself.
I have attached a patch using try-with-resources. [~ozawa] review the patch.
